job_title: Mental Health Technician in Norman, OK
pros: All the overtime you could want, and good benefits
cons:
No adherence to any kind of rules or regulations, even ones that protect patients. They give generous PTO but good luck trying to use any of it. Management and administration do as little as possible for the 24-hr crisis units. The response to COVID was a joke. They claimed they would set aside a "quarantine room". That lasted all of a week. They admitted multiple patients who were confirmed positive for COVID-19. Many of my coworkers got sick, and one of themwas in the ICU for almost 2 weeks. A coworker of mine got stabbed in the back, literally - with a knife, by a patient that was being admitted. Management did nothing to increase security or training; in fact, the only thing they did do was increase the patient capacity. I've seen nurses mess up medication; other techs have beat up patients intentionally when they've acted out; I've been told "do not check on patients while they are sleeping". This place is a joke for healthcare. 

Their motto is Red Rock cares, but after working here for 2+ years, it is clear that they do not.
